instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00164: What is 820-00164? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1465: What is A1465? A1465 is a model number for a 11 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2924, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00164, 820-3208, 820-3435..
definitions.U7090: What is U7090? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V42_G3H.
definitions.D7012: What is D7012? Diode between ground and gate of Q7010 on 2013-2015 year model macbook airs, necessary for Q7010 to allow PPDCIN_G3H to flow through to PP3V42_G3H power supply input. When this diode dies or corrodes, PP3V42_G3H input will not have any voltage, and chargers will not turn on. This can often be the problem if a system only works with a knockoff charger/bench power supply. .
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .
definitions.Q7010: What is Q7010? Q7010 controls whether or not PPDCIN_G3H will be let through to the PP3V42_G3H power supply, often this circuit area is not working because D7010 has died or corroded. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
threads.message: MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> didn?t charge with a tried 2 chargers some Time it works some it didn?t check power bench it works fine. Changed the dc board still same problem. Any advise

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
threads.message: I have changed the <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> Ic still same problem but work with power bench but not with chargers tried a few chargers no luck

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
threads.message:
Looks like leakage on input stage; usually <DIODE>D7012</DIODE>, or <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR>.
But need some voltage readings, or diode mode, to confirm which is.

Post <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR> voltages and <RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR> exact value; ohm scale, measured onboard.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
threads.message: Hi it was <RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR> + <DIODE>D7012</DIODE> cheers for all the help

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
threads.message: Inspect L8304 for high resistance or damage.
